metadata.Title: CVE-2022-48337 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description: GNU Emacs through 28.2 allows attackers to execute commands via shellmetacharacters in the name of a source-code file, because lib-src/etags.cuses the system C library function in its implementation of the etagsprogram. For example, a victim may use the "etags -u *" command (suggestedin the etags documentation) in a situation where the current workingdirectory has contents that depend on untrusted input.

criterions.comment: xemacs21: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
xemacs21-packages: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
emacs25: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
